article_text:
Silicon Valley has pioneered the so-called sharing economy with apps that help individuals exchange goods and services. But a decision by California regulators threatens the car-hailing Uber and other sharing start-ups.

The California Labor Commissioner’s Office this month ordered Uber to reimburse one of its drivers more than $4,000 for business expenses on grounds that she was a company employee rather than independent contractor....

twitter.description: California’s Uber Raid: A state regulator tries to blow up the’ sharing economy’ business model, says a Wall Street Journal editorial.
twitter.title: California’s Uber Raid

image.alt: California’s Uber Raid: A regulator tries to blow up the ‘sharing economy’ business model.
